Stem: Woody, rigid, branched, with thorns up to 15 cm long.
Leaves: Oval with rounded tip, fleshy, bright green, 10-40 mm long.
Flowers: White to purple with 5 petals, 1 cm diameter.
FruitSeeds: Round berries, green when unripe and red when ripe, 5-10 mm diameter, 20-70 seeds per fruit.
Habitat: Dry, sandy woodlands, rangelands, roadsides and waterways.
DistinguishingFeatures: Larger berries and stamens extending outside of the flower compared to native Lycium australe.
